resources.string: Which of the following is not a keyword in Java?
Which of the following method types does not require a return value?
Which are not the output of the following code?
Is int[] j = {0,0,0,1} an instance of an Object?
What will be the output of - true && false || false ?
Is the following a legit statement? Yes / No
Which of the following is not a legit method?
What is the output of the following code?
What is the output of (false && false)^true ?
What is the following code doing?
Create an array and print with random order
Create an array, print it and order from lower lower to higher
Create an array print it and then swap it backwards

string.name: score_wrong
string.b:
You have %d points
 Your wrong answers are:

resources.string: Q1. \'where\' is not a keyword in java
Q2. method type of void does not require a return value
Q4. The wrong answer is "654321", make sure you checked ALL the false outputs :)
Q5. True AND false OR false is false
Q8. It is true as a Rabbit is a child of LiveStock
Q9. private String andMe() {}; has no return statement
Q10. !IsItGreen will return true and the first block will be compiled only
Q11. (false && false)^true will end up true :D
Q12. The output is random integer from 0 to 10
Q13. Yes it is a recursion function
Q14. Bubble sort :) you can google it, it\'s interesting :)
